title: Drawing, "Design for clock", 1800–25
medium: Brush and yellow and red watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper
markings: Lower center:  Cooper Union stamp #457 D
inscribed: Below center: L'amour de la fontaine, No. 159.60
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Clock sits on footed base, lower panel decorated with palmette motifs. At left, a winged cupid gazes at a mask of Medusa spouting water into a basin. A quiver stands beside basin. Above, a dial with a footed bowl at top.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for clock", 1800–25.
1800–25. Brush and yellow and red watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-71-10.
